{{also|w√´r|wer-|WER}} ==English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|en|were}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|en|enm|wer}}, from {{inh|en|ang|wer||a male being, man, husband, hero}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*weraz||man}}, from {{inh|en|ine-pro|*wiHr√≥s||man, freeman}}. Cognate with {{cog|gmh|w√´r||man}}, {{cog|sv|v√§rbror||brother-in-law}}, {{cog|no|verfader||father-in-law}}, {{cog|la|vir||man, husband}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|obsolete}} A [[man]]. # {{lb|en|obsolete}} [[wergeld|Wergeld]]. ====Related terms==== * {{l|en|werewolf}} * {{l|en|wergeld}} * {{l|en|world}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=erw|Rew|erw|rew}} ---- ==Cornish== ===Adjective=== {{head|kw|mutated adjective}} # {{soft mutation of|kw|gwer}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gem-pro|*hwaz}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*k ∑is}}. Related to {{m|de|wo}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/veÀê…êÃØ/|/v…õ…êÃØ/}} * {{audio|de|De-wer.ogg|Audio}} * {{homophones|de|Wehr}} * {{rhymes|de|eÀê…êÃØ}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun|cat2=interrogative pronouns|cat3=relative pronouns}} # {{lb|de|interrogative}} [[who]] {{gloss|what person or people}} #: '''''Wer''' hat das gesagt?'' ‚Äì '''Who''' said that? # {{lb|de|interrogative|colloquial}} [[what]], [[which]] (one) ''(see usage notes)'' # {{lb|de|relative}} [[whoever]], [[he]] who, [[someone]] who, the [[person]] who, [[anyone]] who {{gloss|whatever person or persons}} #: {{ux|de|'''Wer''' eine Frage hat, kann sich jetzt melden.|'''Whoever''' has a question, put up their hands now.}} # {{lb|de|indefinite|colloquial}} [[somebody]], [[someone]]; [[anybody]], [[anyone]] {{gloss|an unspecified person}} #: ''Da ist '''wer''' an der T√ºr.'' ‚Äì There's '''somebody''' at the door. ====Usage notes==== * {{sense|what}} In colloquial German, ''wer'' and its forms may be used in reference to things. This is often done when asking about a noun whose gender one knows to be masculine or feminine. For example: ''Kannst du mir mal den Dings r√ºbergeben?'' ‚Äì '''''Wen'''?'' (‚ÄúCould you pass me the thingamabob?‚Äù ‚Äì ‚ÄúPass '''what'''?‚Äù) In this case, the interrogative mirrors the gender of the noun one asks about. * {{sense|someone}} The colloquial ''wer'' meaning ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù cannot usually be the first word in a main clause, because it could be misinterpreted as an interrogative in this position. The only exception is when it is followed by a nominalized adjective: *: '''''Wer''' Neues ist in die Mannschaft gekommen.'' ‚Äì '''Someone''' new joined the team. ====Inflection==== * {{l|en|nominative|'''N'''}}: {{l|de|wer}} * {{l|en|genitive|'''G'''}}: {{l|de|wessen}} ‚Äì obsolete, poetic: {{l|de|wes}} * {{l|en|dative|'''D'''}}: {{l|de|wem}} * {{l|en|accusative|'''A'''}}: {{l|de|wen}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|indefinite, colloquial}} {{l|de|jemand}}, {{l|de|einer}} ====Coordinate terms==== * {{l|de|was}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|irgendwer}} * {{l|de|wer da}} * {{l|de|Werdaruf}} * {{l|de|Werfall}} * {{l|de|Wemfall}} * {{l|de|Wenfall}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*hwaz}}, from {{inh|hrx|ine-pro|*k ∑is}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/Ààv…õ…êÃØ/}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|hrx|pronoun}} # {{lb|hrx|interrogative}} [[who]] #: {{ux|hrx|'''Wer''' kommd dart? |'''Who''' goes there?}} #: {{ux|hrx|'''Wer''' sihst-du?|'''Who''' do you see?}} ===See also=== * [[wem]] ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Kurdish== ===Adverb=== {{head|ku|adverbs}} # [[so]] ---- ==Kuri== ===Noun=== {{head|nbn|noun}} # [[water]] ===References=== * {{R:Voorhoeve Irian Jaya}}, [https://web.archive.org/web/20130517204250/http://www.papuaweb.org/dlib/bk/pl/B31/09.pdf page 123] ---- ==Meriam== ===Noun=== {{head|ulk|nouns}} # [[egg]] # [[testicle]] # [[star]] ---- ==Middle English== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|enm|ang|wer}}, from {{inh|enm|gem-pro|*weraz}}, from {{inh|enm|ine-pro|*wiHr√≥s}}; compare {{cog|non|verr}}, {{cog|la|vir}}, {{cog|prg|wijrs}}, {{cog|sa|‡§µ‡•Ä‡§∞}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|enm|/w…õr/}} ====Noun==== {{enm-noun}} # a [[man]], a [[husband]] =====Related terms===== * {{l|enm|werwolf}} * {{l|enm|world}} =====Descendants===== * {{desc|en|wer}}, {{l|en|were}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|enm|ang|w«£re}}. ====Verb==== {{head|enm|verb form}} # {{alt form|enm|were}} ===Etymology 3=== From Late {{inh|enm|ang|werre}}, {{m|ang|wyrre|t=war}}. ====Noun==== {{head|enm|noun}} # {{alt form|enm|werre|t=war}} [[Category:enm:Male]] [[Category:enm:Marriage]] [[Category:enm:People]] ---- ==Ndom== ===Noun=== {{head|nqm|noun}} # [[water]] ===References=== * ''Oceanic linguistics'', volumes 20 √† 21, University Press of Hawaii, page 129, 1981 ---- ==Old English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|ang|[[∆øer]], [[w√¶r]]}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/wer/}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|ang|gem-pro|*weraz}}, from {{inh|ang|ine-pro|*wiHr√≥s||freeman}}.
